questions.question: Where should you first look for official AWS troubleshooting guides?
options: AWS re:Post Knowledge Center and official documentation
questions.explanation: AWS re:Post Knowledge Center and official documentation (docs.aws.amazon.com) contain curated, accurate troubleshooting guides. These should be your first stop for AWS-specific issues.

questions.question: Match each support plan with its response time for production system down:
questions.explanation: Basic has no technical support. Developer has 12-24 hour response. Business has 1-hour response for production down. Enterprise has 15-minute response for critical issues.

questions.question: What is included with AWS Basic Support (free tier)? (Select ALL that apply)
questions.explanation: Basic Support includes documentation, Trusted Advisor core checks (limited), and billing support. 24/7 phone technical support requires Business or Enterprise plans.

questions.question: How many pillars are in the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
questions.explanation: The Well-Architected Framework has 6 pillars: Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, Cost Optimization, and Sustainability (added in 2021).

questions.question: All AWS Trusted Advisor checks are available with Basic Support.
questions.explanation: Basic and Developer Support only get core Trusted Advisor checks (security and service limits). Full Trusted Advisor with cost optimization and performance checks requires Business or Enterprise Support.

questions.question: Arrange these troubleshooting steps in the recommended order:
items: Check CloudWatch logs and error messages
Search AWS documentation and Knowledge Center
questions.explanation: Start by checking logs and errors, then search official documentation, ask the community, and finally open a support case if still unresolved. This approach solves most issues faster.
